page.title: 17AMENITIES
page.content: NUN MONKTON IN THE RURAL DISTRICT OF HARROGATE HAS A P.O. AND VILLAGE SHOP. THERE IS A DAILY COLLECTION AND DELIVERY OF MAIL AND A PUBLIC TELEPHONE KIOSK. THE POSTAL DISTRICT AND THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE ARE AT GREEN HAMMERTON. THERE IS NO BUS SERVICE AND NO STREET LIGHTING. DOMESTIC ELECTRICITY IS SUPPLIED BY N.E.E.B.. YORKSHIRE WATER AUTHORITY SUPPLY PIPED WATER. THE ALICE HAWTHORN PUBLIC HOUSE NAMED AFTER A FAMOUS LOCAL RACE HORSE SERVES BAR MEALS. MOST HOUSE-HOLDS HAVE PRIVATE TELEPHONES. ACCESS TO THE VILLAGE FROM THE A59 YORK TO HARROGATE ROAD IS ALONG POOL LANE WHICH IS UNCLASSIFIED. THERE ARE MAIN SEWERS. DOCTOR AND NURSE COME FROM GREEN HAMMERTON. THERE IS NO GARAGE OR PETROL STATION IN THE VILLAGE. THE CHURCHYARD IS NOW FULL.A NEW BURIAL GROUND IS IN THE PARK.
